text.section:
Except as otherwise provided in this section for an action under § 5-311 of this subtitle, any person aggrieved by a final decision of the Board in a contested case, as defined in the Administrative Procedure Act, may:
Appeal that decision to the Board of Review; and
Then take any further appeal allowed by the Administrative Procedure Act.

section.section: Any person aggrieved by a final decision of the Board under § 5-311 of this subtitle may not appeal to the Secretary or the Board of Review but may take a direct judicial appeal.
The appeal shall be made pursuant to the provisions on judicial review of final decisions in Title 10, Subtitle 2 of the State Government Article.

text.section: An order of the Board may not be stayed pending review.
